Reviews.Title: “false advertising”
Reviews.Author: SelinaLuisa
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered quality accommodation in inner Sydney for a special deal advance purchase. The advertised one night for 2 people deal was sold for around $130 and the printed voucher said it was worth $245. There were conditions - black out dates and a request for early booking and rooms subject to availability. I wrote asking for a booking (I did not mention the deal as the voucher just said hand over on arrival). I was offered two kinds of room - standard at $159 and superior at $179 with extra for parking and breakfast. I wrote back accepting the deal and provided the voucher number. The hotel advised that they did not have available rooms, that 'voucher rooms' had all gone and perhaps later in the year would be better. I have major problems with this attitude and failure to honour a promise: 1. available rooms are not available for pre-purchased voucher holders 2. the cost of the room was not much more than the voucher, but it said the deal was worth $245. 3. the attitude of the hotel staff was of complete lack of responsibility or sense of obligation. I will never go to find out if this hotel has quality rooms and fittings. They are dishonourable.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend it more highly, but don't have the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Katharine T
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, go there. If you want to be close to everything, yet still feel relaxed, this is your hotel. This would be a perfect hotel for an affordable, comfortable and relaxed family getaway to see the sights of Sydney, to anyone who wants to be near everything they need to do in Sydney Above all the customer service was impeccable. Any query, and the reception staff were fantastic. Which for us was highly valued as it made us feel very comfortable and valued. Especially as we were there for an intensive two day course at UTS. (which if you are going to is two blocks away, 5min walk, just cut through the 'Tafe' building, which we did with no hassle both days). I have noticed other reviews calling it outdated, personally, best value for money hotel I have ever stayed at. The room we stayed in (116) was just as nice, only smaller than a hotel I stayed last year that was more than double the price. Everything I want in a hotel, relaxing, safe, nice interior, easy access to everything, value for money and above all being valued as a customer, I found in this hotel. Our only problem was the restraunt. We had the "$15 extra" breakfast and were very disappointed. The fruit wasn't fresh, the hot food was unappetizing, there was little variety for a 'buffet' breakfast and they even served what we assumed to be last night's left overs as a part of their hot food. We later found out the restaurant is a seperately run business. Which made a lot of sense when our dealings with the reception staff greatly polarized our experience with the restaurant. The restaurant does have a pleasing atmosphere with a nice covered outside area and if you want the convenience of having breakfast before you go out for the day its fine. But only if you you want to get ripped off at $15 per person, per day, for off fruit and hot food the caliber of a bad overnight school excursion. They only food I liked was a bowl of nutrigrain cereal and a piece of toast with butter and jam. I highly agree with "melwollongong" positive review of their family's experience. And like her, I "will definitely be staying here" for all my future trips to Sydney. Just not having the breakfast in the restaurant, which has not tainted my great experience at the hotel, as it is a separately run business. Overall, go there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but needs a refresh”
Reviews.Author: Paul1005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Central Station. Once you figure out which exit to take from the station the hotel is easy to find. As other reviews suggest the reception is dated and dark, but the staff were friendly and helpful. The room itself was large but very dark and again dated, but held 2 comfortable double beds. The Bathroom was large and clean and had Shower Gel, Shampoo, Shaving Gel and body lotion available. We needed to checkout by 10.00 but our flight wasn't unit 18.00. The hotel has a complimentary secure storage room so that you can store your luggage. There is nothing much in the local area but the train & Monorail stops are within 5 minutes walk, or you can easily walk to Darling Harbour or the rocks along George or Pitt street which are both a couple of roads from the station. The walk to the rocks took us 20-25 minutes at a comfotable pace and with a 12 year old in tow. Overall this hotel is nice if a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price for a great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: melwollongong
Reviews.Content: Could not believe that I could find a hotel room that sleeps 5-6 people, in the heart of the city of Sydney for only $135 during Easter/School holiday period. Parking was only $10 and covered us from 6am on the day of check-in until 6pm the day of checkout! We took advantage and arrived at the hotel at 10.30am and I was amazed that our room was ready (even though check-in was not until 2pm) and the friendly staff were happy for us to check-in straight away! Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Very quiet and bed was very comfortable, great night's sleep. Location was good, a 10 minute walk to George Street where you can catch the free 555 bus to key Sydney sights. 5-10 minute walk to Darling Harbour. I was impressed with this hotel (for the price) and will definitely be staying here for my next family trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Noting to aspire”
Reviews.Author: AJ L
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and coming from a long days work the hotel reception is nothing to aspire. Very crude and rude. If you can not serve customer right then do not work in the service industry. Forced to stay because company booked it. The Only thing to aspire this time is to check out as early as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, well located to the Powerhouse museum - book ahead.”
Reviews.Author: travelvictoria
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Aspire for one night, to see the Harry Potter exhibition at the Powerhouse museum, which is just a block away from the hotel. The hotel is also within walking distance to Darling Harbour, yet it is located in a leafy residential area. The front desk staff were friendly and courteous. The room was spacious, clean and surprisingly well appointed, with a flat screen tv, crisp clean sheets, plenty of wardrobe and suitcase storage space. The room had a large balcony too. I had asked for a quiet room which I got, but the bathroom had a water leek from the ceiling vent,that dripped over the bathroom floor. The staff kindly offered the only other room available as a substitute, but as it was a noisy room next to an elevator, I declined as I am a light sleeper. The bathroom floor was wiped clean by the staff and a bucket placed under the leek, which slowly dripped all night. Under the circumstances a concession of some kind, such as breakfast, or a room rate discount may have been appropriate. Apart from this, my daughter and I were happy with the location, staff, room rate and room furnishings (dated but quite acceptable). The only food available at the hotel is the breakfast, priced at $15-. However there are a few food shops not far away. As this hotel is well priced at between $99-$130 per night, (excellent for Sydney) I recommend booking ahead to ensure you get a room.

Reviews.Title: “dkm”
Reviews.Author: Dnice M
Reviews.Content: Good value for location to light rail and monorail. Staff helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good value but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: Eddie C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very dated and needs a refurb badly. The reception area is dirty, dark and dated, the room we stayed it was similar. Lounges were stained and dirty, cushions stained and torn. Bathroom leaked very badly into the main bedroom area which no doubt contributed to the musty smell encountered throughout the hotel. On the plus side, the rooms are large, the service reasonable, and the location is great. Easy to get to downtown Sydney, without the hassles of negotiating CBD traffic if you happen to be driving.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: beverly p
Reviews.Content: It was clean except for two cockroaches we shared with,two beds were great but the sofa bed was terriable had to put mattress on floor,we were happy with location within walking distance to George St,also close to Monorail and was in a quiet area would stay again but make sure cockroaches removed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: magicmum4
Reviews.Content: Darling Harbour is a great place to stay. This hotel is in a quiet residential street within 5 - 7 minutes of the tram and monorail stop, 5 minutes to the Powerhouse Museum and Paddy's Market. The rooms are large and well appointed, beds comfortable, good clean bathroom with plenty of hot water, and a hair dryer - nice ! Air conditioned, but also a lovely balcony door with an insect screen so I could have fresh air which was wonderful. I'm not sure what people are expecting for a budget hotel price but it was certainly well within what I wanted. No bells and whistles - I don't care about digital TV and DVD players, I'm not going to be sitting in my room ! It doesn't matter if the decor isn't the latest, as long as it fulfills the function, and you don't need to have food on site.There is a very nice all day breakfast cafe 2 minutes away with a wonderful menu, and several other cafes in the area. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone on a budget and it will be my hotel of choice the next time I come to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if your desperate”
Reviews.Author: meryn62
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such an out dated hotel ever before. There wasn't enough towels or pillows for the guests and they only had analog tv in the rooms. If you wanted you could pay extra and get a dvd player . We couldn't get out of our room as the door handle kept getting stuck. Not a good safety issue. The water was hot and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel - Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: SometimesSkiing
Reviews.Content: In Sydney for a exhibition and found this hotel very handy to Darling Harbour (easy walk) which gives you easy access to all the facilities in Darling Harbour, also an easy walk to downtown. The area is very quiet and there is very little traffice noise at night, also off Harris street so quieter foot traffic as well. THE HOTEL: The prices were fairly reasonable for Sydney and the location, the staff were freindly and helful but that is as far as the good points extend. The reception area was very old and tired, the rooms were equally old and tired, the beds were uncomfortable, the bathroom was damp and mouldy. The buffet breakfast was horrible, the hot food was cold and the cold food was hot, service was not there. If your budget is low and you want somewhere close to Darling Harbour and happy to rough it is a below 2 star hotel, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again - need restoration”
Reviews.Author: Eric890
Reviews.Content: Good: 1) Location, it is very close to Darling Harbour but at the same time it is in a quiet neighborhood with almost no noise 2)Price Bad: 1)Rooms were dirty 2)The rooms are in an urgent need of restoration, the carpets are old and dirty, the walls had marks on it, the bathroom is extremelly old and outdated. Another issue we had was that the elevator broke on our second day and there was a sign to use the stairs. As we went throught the stairs we could not get out in the reception floor because it was locked. As a result we stayed several minutes locked in the stairs until someone came to "rescue" us, it was very unorganized. The final issue we had was that my husband asked for directions to get to a tourist attraction in the reception and the staff gave us wrong directions, luckily we found this out before getting there. Would not recommend this Hotel specially because of dirtiness and outdated bathroom and room.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel at central location”
Reviews.Author: ViciousTravelling
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure to stay here for 2 nights in Dec. Might be a little challenging to get to on own, I took a shuttle. Found it extremely central to many of the Sydney offerings like Aquarium, Imax, HRC to name a few. The hotel is simple, spacious rooms and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The rooms however were a bit dated and I personally think they needed to be refurbished. The price was right for central Sydney and I feel that this was their main strength. Also I consider them to be in a safe area. Would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Aspire Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glenda S
Reviews.Content: Good location - no noise, a short walk to central station and broadway bus stops, comfortable beds. On the down side, for older less active people - a bit of a walk to public transport. Few Australian eateries close by. We had a major problem with the supply of hot water for bathing. we stayed 3 nights - i reported this on the first morning of our stay; problem was supposedly rectified; no change, reported again - yet to see the outcome. After the second report i was told that there must have been a problem that morning with the whole hotel and yet no one else had reported the problem. Was not given any alternative or recompense. Was then advised that i should just wait 10 mins as it was probably because everyone was trying to have a shower at the same time . . . three different times of the day. Room was dirty - not vacummed properly with chocolate wrappers, medication and paper from previous guests in the room, mould in the grouting in the shower and dusty screen door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: katsrule
Reviews.Content: This hotel it in a great location, it is on a quiet street, is 5 mins walk if that to the Power House Museum and about 10 minutes walk to Monorail and Darling Harbour. The rooms were big, there were four of us in the room, the staff were excellent. you have tea and coffee making facilities, there is a fridge in the room but no mini bar (this did not worry us), but those who do like a mini bar they did have a vending machine type bar in reception. The beds were so comfortable, proabably one of the best beds we have slept on in a hotel in a long time. The only negative thing I would have to stay is that the bathroom needed abit of a make over (this isn't a big issue), and that there isn't a resturarant that you can use at night at the hotel, they do have breakfast available in the mornings at $15 per head all you can eat (bacon, eggs, baked beans, sausages, ceral, toast, fruit just to name a few). Even with no restuarant onsite for dinner, the staff were eagar to assist and inform us where to go, we ended up walking 5 mins up the road to an amazing Pizza Place, the best Pizza I have eaten. I will certainly recommend staying here and if we head back to Sydney we would look at booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates for a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Annette H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a quiet street and is well positioned for Chinatown and Darling Harbour. I stayed for 6 nights and the reasonable prices gave me a large room, good bed and pleasant and helpful staff. It is true the hotel looks a bit dated, and my bathroom needed a good scrub/paint but I didn't expect it would be perfect at those rates. My husband who came for the last couple of nights was annoyed by a noisy air conditioning system but it was OK by me. Fortunately I had reasonable neighbours because the walls are quite thin so it could be a different story if you had a bad snorer next door. A blower could have got rid of the cigarette butts on the roof below my verandah but it was a pleasant view through the trees in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, very helpful staff, in easy reach of city.”
Reviews.Author: SusanJH11
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced for Sydney hotel, as they can be expensive. Bring comfortable shoes if you don't want to spend a fortune on taxis, it's 15 minutes to Darling Harbour for restaurants, museums, cruises and 50 to Opera House and Circular Quay. Easy walking though through Chinatown and main shopping areas, so lots to see on the way. Larger than average room, clean and comfortable. Wifi only seems to work in hotel lobby, not bedrooms, and at $5 an hour, not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the money and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bali888
Reviews.Content: Got room 414, which is on the top floor. It is a bit larger then a standard room in the hotel. Worth the money. Everything was clean, although the balcony could use a good scrubbing. Black feet...

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel close to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jwaters1969
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel that is about 10-15 minute walk to Darling Harbour and a bit more to the CBD. The hotel was clean and rooms were a good size with a balcony (the east side has a view of the city). The beds were a bit soft for my liking and I ended up with a stiff neck but then again when you are paying just over $100 p/n for a place so close the CBD I am not going to complain about that too much. The rooms in general are what I would expect from paying this price, clean but dated bathrooms and living areas. There is a fridge in your room but no minibar, although you can purchase some items from a vending machine in the lobby. The staff were mostly friendly although some of them could do with understanding and exhibiting some common sense. When I arrived at 1:50pm on the tuesday the staff member at first told me the room wasnt ready as "check in was at 2pm". I pointed out that 10 minutes shouldn't make a lot of difference and then she called housekeeping and found out the room was actually ready. To my mind it would have been better for her to check before making the statement? The other example was at checkout I had organised a shuttle to the airport, when I paid and the shuttle turned up they hadnt given me a ticket so I asked at reception. The girl who had organised my checkout 15 mins prior (and I had stood out the front of the glass doors waiting for the shuttle in the meantime) told me there was no record of me staying at the hotel? I pointed out to her that she had just checked me out at which point it seemed to click with her that what she had said was absurd. I got my ticket although I am not sure she knew what she was doing as she gave me a blank ticket, I think it was to save her any more embarrasment? Other than these 2 experiences the staff were helpful with directions and the actual stay was good. Probably the other thing I thought was a bit strange was the TV only having analogue reception, and the 'new' release DVD's available included Titanic and Die Hard 4? Overall this hotel was a good stay for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lagoongirl18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel to have everything we needed. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful. We had pre booked and asked for a quiet room with a balcony, and got a lovely quiet room over looking a little park - where early in the morning we would watch some elderly chinese ladies doing tai chi. The hotel is situated a little out of the way - a bit of a walk down to China town, but various transport options available from there. Also the bright red 'hop on hop off' bus has a stop just around the corner, if you are planning to take a tour - was very good $35 per person, travel all around the city, getting on and off where you please, and it also has a bus to Bondi beach, Rose bay and Double bay which was also awesome to explore, a ticket is valid for 24hrs or a bit more for 48hrs. The hotel itself is clean and tidy, room was serviced daily. Our room did not have a microwave, but had jug and fridge, and the tea and coffee/milk was refilled daily, it had airconditioning and a small TV, which we didn't have time to watch.They booked our airport shuttle and everything went smoothly. Would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for concerts at Sydney Entertainamnet Centre”
Reviews.Author: Sonia M
Reviews.Content: We tsayed here recently for a concert at the Entertainment Centre in China town. It was a 5 minute walk and mostly under cover. The hotel is in a very quiet street. Beds were very soft and lifts didn't work too well but apart from that the staff were very friednly and helpful and it has an underground carpark. the cost was very reasonable for being so close to Sydney... so if you needto go to a concert and stay over this is a great option... and there is china town on your doorstep for yumcha and darling harbour a short walk too... it is a little hidden budget option. room was large and there was even a bath!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: troy271
Reviews.Content: In a great location, only a ten minute walk from Central Station, Darling Harbour and Star City. Five mins to the Powerhouse, and its associated Monorail and Light Rail stops. But despite being in such a central location, the surrounding area was very quiet and peaceful. The hotel itself had a bit of charm about it, and the staff were very nice as well. Room was clean and maintained well by the housekeeping staff, bathroom seemed newly refurbished and modern. Things that needed improvement are: Lack of mini bar. Theres a small fridge in every room, but nothing in it. Wouldnt it be better value if it were stocked with overpriced food and drinks, rather than just wasting electricity? Television. The TV in my room wasnt even digital, and thus only picked up 5 channels. In an age where most motels have Foxtel, to not even have digital tv was dissapointing. Lifts. Going up for the first time, none of the lifts worked and they had to be reset. Upon me checking out, one was being serviced on my floor, thus it took 10 minutes for one to reach me. And there are no stairs for use as well. Overall, it was a nice little motel to sleep in for the duration of my stay, but nothing more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: colin0235
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near darling harbour. It is an old hotel and the bathroom needed renovation. The room was a good size with ample room for three adults. The staff were helpful and obliging. You wont get the hilton but will get value if you get a good rate. They do have onsite parking at reasonable rates (for sydney).

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: welovetravels21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents while we were visiting Sydney. One of the reasons why we chose this hotel was because it fit 3 people in a room. Our room had a double bed and a single bed. Sheets were clean and bed was comfy. Bathroom ceiling had a huge patch of mould and so was the balcony wall. It does need some good maintenance there. There isn't free WiFi provided in the rooms, we had to pay about $10 for 24 hour use. Otherwise we were satisfied with everything. Location was not too far off Chinatown, about 15-20 minute walk, convenient for eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Our regular hotel when in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ross l
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have been to this hotel 3 times now. It's location is absolutely ideal. Paddy's market just down the road...the monorail just down the road. The area is fairly leafy considering how close it is to Sydney. The hotel staff are always pleasant and helpful. The more times you stay at the hotel you get little rewards. We got an upgrade to a deluxe room which was basically the same as a standard but had more space. The next time we stay we will get a chance in a draw for free accommadation. The rooms are clean and tidy but are showing their age. Wash basin is plastic and has a lot of cracks (unhygienic). The ensuite/bathroom needs an exhaust fan. Tv is outdated, channels very limited. Doors and wooden trims are in an outdated dark burgundy varnish finish. Makes the overall look too dull compared to more modern decors of hotels. Overall it's a good compromise hotel re area and accommdation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Balanced_reviews
Reviews.Content: Great balance between location and value. Easy reach of all amenties and attractions. Very helpful staff on reception - great suggestion of places to eat at great prices. Parking underneath extra but reasonable value. Fleixible about arrival and departure times if discussed in advance. Would stay again. Big comfy room.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel close to Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: surfer56_19
Reviews.Content: We found the Aspire a very welcome end to our holiday in Australia. Although one might consider it to be a little tired with the decor, the staff were friendly and very accommodating to all enquiries made by visitors, taking time out to help with booking trips etc. Our room was very comfortable, beds very comfortable ( very important) and from our perspective it fitted our particular criteria in wanting something close to the centre of Sydney that also provided us with a quite retreat for some " recharging of batteries". With tea making facilities,as well as toiletries from specific dispensers e.g shaving foam, shower gel, conditioner etc, one wouldn't need to buy any of these, unless you had a particular preference for your own brand of toiletry products. All in all, this hotel offers a very reasonable alternative to the more expensive hotels that are in and around central Sydney, and whilst it wouldn't fit everyone's expectations ( there is no one size fits all situation) I know would have no hesistation in booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: Miffy33
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this hotel we arrived not expecting much. We had purchased a package on a group buying site so could not back out, but when we arrived there we found it to be more than adequate. The hotel is in a GREAT location, a street back from the city centre but so lovely and quiet you would not know! The rooms were very clean and large, and whilst yes, there are some rather dated features, the updated linen and art work gave the room a slightly more modern and clean feel. One of the staff on duty was VERY helpful, any question we had he was able to give us detailed help, another staff member was much more vague, and if we had been oversease or interstate visitors her 'instructions' would have got us hopelessly lost, but we knew the area somewhat. The lifts need updating, as does the air cons in the rooms, but they work, and it all adds to the character of the place. One thing this hotel REALLY needs to do is to get some new tvs, or at least some set top boxes, but it is not something that would stop us returning as who goes to a hotel to just sit there and watch tv anyway!? We did not eat in the restaurant so cannot comment on it, but I am sure it would have been fine, we just had vouchers for other restaurants as part of our deal. Overall it was a great very pleasant experience and we would return to this hotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but flawed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Yamaha2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights as part of an Oz tour. Friendly, efficient reception staff so check in was seamless and as we arrived very early, they provided luggage storage until check in time arrived. Huge comfortable room with massive bed, all the usual tea/coffee facilities etc plus a concealed safe for your valuables but the bathroom was somewhat tired with cracked tiles and a ceiling that looked like it was on its way to collapse. Interesting breakfast room (The Walkabout suite!) complete with waterfall on the rear wall. Great selection to choose from so no complaint there. If you are going to the airport on checkout and use the shuttle bus, make sure the reception give you your ticket after you pay. It saves confusion and an argument with the driver at the airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: 4u5tr4v3l
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times previously and have stayed here again for the last week. The location is fantastic - only 300m or so from Paddy's Markets and 500m from Darling Harbour. It's just to the south in a nice, quiet area. The great thing about this place though is the staff. They're very personable and great to deal with. I've been staying in hotels now for the last 16 months and staff members like Ben and Cheten are the reason that I keep coming back to a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Functional Affair”
Reviews.Author: TheHoodedBanoonigan
Reviews.Content: Why stay here? Darling Walk and Cockle Bay are an easy 5-10 walk from Aspire Hotel, which may appeal to those staying in town for a concert,or to watch the FIFA World Cup with the masses. The walk to the Sydney Opera House is another 10 minutes, and will take you by some quality eateries. If you are prepared to walk, you wont need money for cabs - spend that on an extra bottle of vino at dinner. The Hotel is, however, outside of the CBD and there is nothing to do within direct proximity of the Hotel itself. Which brings me to the negatives. The rooms are cave-like, the service worthy of a cave, the decor purely functional, the views from the cave uninspiring, the lifts to your room more akin to a coffin than a modern piece of machinery. In short, this is the perfect lair for a Batman on the move. For the rest of us, if you are coming to Sydney to experience Sydney, you will feel distinctly out of the loop; I would recommend something more central, or on the other side of town. In short, the Aspire is purely functional, and strictly for those intending to spend most of their time away from the Hotel on Aspire's side of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: MiMi&Sue
Reviews.Content: Positives: - quiet, convenient location - inexpensive - clean, big rooms Negatives - a little frayed at the edges - minimal amenities It is hard to reconcile some of the reviews I've read with the hotel I stayed in. True it is now a little worn, with some of the varnish chipped on the woodwork, and similar signs of fraying around the edges. But everything was clean, and kept clean throughout my 8 day stay. It is situated in a quiet street one block back from Harris St, to find any hotel so central in Sydney on such a quiet street was surprising. Obviously not one of the wealthiest streets in Sydney it cannot be described as in any way "dirty" unless one is referring to the varied ethnicity of the residents. It is tree-lined, with some of the original terrace houses still in existence. An outdoor cafe in a pleasant treed square a few doors up was a good place for breakfast. It was very convenient. Only a short walk from Darling Harbour with its museums, attractions, restaurants and shops, and a slightly longer walk into Chinatown. As I was working at the Exhibition Centre, it was an easy walk to work in the morning. Convenient monorail and tram stops gave quick access to the centre of the city and Central Station respectively. One aspect is that there were not many amenities. The TV was analogue, and inhouse movies consisted of a DVD player and DVD's that had to be hired specially. A digital TV, with all the additional channels would have improved the stay enormously. There was also no room service, a little inconvenient. But again there were takeaways a short walk away, and plenty of other options a little further. There was a free morning paper, breakfast was available in the restaurant, and the bathroom had a good selection of bits and pieces. But the rooms were big (hate a cramped hotel room), clean and for me the air conditioning worked perfectly. For the price very hard to beat. (I paid about $129 per night).

Reviews.Title: “One to AVOID !!”
Reviews.Author: dilagri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in desperate need of a refurb! We stayed for 2 nights in January, and were very very disappointed. Everything about the hotel is run down, from the reception, to the lift, & the rooms. We had initially booked for 3 nights, and begrudgingly confirmed our 3d night booking with a member of staff who was on night duty, only to be told by the Manager at 11 o clock the following morning that they had no room for us! My wife & our 4 small children were told that we had to be out of our room by 1 o clock !! The french manager was obnoxious & rude, and certainly should not be in charge of a pram let alone a hotel in Sydney. This was in fact a godsend, as we then got a room at the Marriott Hotel in Pitt street near Circular Quay, not only was this hotel superb, but also cheaper !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, reasonable comfort, large room”
Reviews.Author: ksparkle_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend away, having previously stayed once before. Yes, the hotel is getting on, so the room fittings are a bit dated. One example is the darkened patch of wall, complete with small holes, where some piece of furniture was obviously fixed in former times. But, if you don't mind this, the rooms are very pleasant: large beds, large rooms, plenty of space to place suitcases, some armchairs. Also no problems as far as cleanliness is concerned. Our room had aircon, but also a sliding door, so you could have fresh air as well! Good location if you don't want to be in the centre of Sydney; it's quiet, but plenty of nice cafes and lots of convenience stores around. Easy walk to Darling Harbour and Central Station. Also seems fairly unknown - the taxi driver hadn't heard of it - which could be a problem if you're completely new to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price close to Paddy's market, monorail and the powerhouse museum.”
Reviews.Author: lancastrianUk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights to see if it was ok, ended up staying here much longer as we found it a very convenient place to be in Sydney. We left for a week in the blue mountains and then returned to the Aspire for a further 5 or 6 days. Our room was serviced daily and it was very nice returning to a clean room, we found housekeeping excellent. All the rooms we stayed in had balconies which was nice, in the evening it was wonderful to watch the fruit bats fly over. We used the room's chairs and coffee table to sit on the balcony which was fine. The Ian Thorpe leisure centre is close by if you like to swim, it has a great 50m pool. There are good affordable take-aways close by, and a lovely cafe where you can have breakfast should you need them. The Kopitiam Malaysian Cafe was particularly good, eat in or take-away. Although the Aspire does not have the latest in decor and fittings it is still (we thought )a great place to stay for the price in Sydney. Though I do remember the price rising considerable on Saturday, we went to Parramatta for Saturday night which was cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms, Dirty Location, NOT worth the price”
Reviews.Author: LinzAdam
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed with the mold on our bathroom ceiling, the broken air conditioner in 35 degree heat, the mixing up of reservations and poor handling by staff, the dirty streets outside, or the overpriced, terrible restaurant downstairs. It was a last minute decision to stay and if we had time we would have gone elsewhere. As soon as we were able, we left for another hotel ASAP! Overall, the feeling of the place is a bit like "the Shining"...antequeated, smelly and dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for grandmother and 2 boys aged 11 and 9”
Reviews.Author: BegaBrenda
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money.Large room with room for boys to draw, play games. Very quiet. Own ac setting. Ensuite had bath. 2 minutes to Powerhouse Museum, 5 min to Darling Harbour and buses in George St. Bit of a walk to Central but boys used it as part of the adventure. This might be a problem for younger children. Stayed 3 days. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aspire Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Audreyjalexis
Reviews.Content: Aspire Hotel is at a secluded location and doesn't have anything great to see or do. Though the monorail is at walking distance, the main attractions are still far. The check in is at 2'o clock. We arrived a little early and the staff didn't check in even though they convinced that they will check us in immediately after any of the guests leave. But nothing happened and only at 2 we were checked in. There is no free wi-fi as advertised on the site and we had to pay $10 per day for it. There was no shower cap in the room. Plus the cleaning people didn't go a very good job in the 3 days we stayed there. Coffee and tea is provided in the room with an electric kettle. Sleep quality is good but no real view outside the room. Breakfast is fine with a range of options available.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: tlittlej
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at this hotel from 12/12-12/15. I was definitely shocked when the taxi was driving through the neighborhood. I thought the hotel was in more of business area. I was wondering about safety at night originally but didn't spend much time out and around the area once the sun went down. Once I walked into the hotel I realized how old the place looked. The receptionist was on the phone speaking with someone who's television wasn't working. He advised me that they had wireless internet but it doesn't work in the rooms so I would have to work in computer center. I would take my laptop downstairs and get connected and then go back to my room and could actually keep the connection. The next thing occurred shortly after I arrived, a gentleman got his arm stuck in the elevator door but the emergency button didn't work. I didn't get all the conversation but he was upset no one came to help him. All three elevators need work done, they are the loudest I have ever been in and the sound it makes when it starts makes you very uncomfortable, even on a short ride. This hotel had a very old feel to it but it was one of the cheaper hotels on list of hotels I could get picked up for the tour I was taking. Not bad for a day or two maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Average in every way”
Reviews.Author: engam
Reviews.Content: Located in an area away from public transport, the only means were walk and taxi. It was not too far from Chinatown if you knew how to negotiate through the turns and bends. The hotel and the furnishings were very dated. I booked a queen room for single occupancy, but was given a room with 3 beds, making the room felt very cramped. I asked to move to a room with just a queen bed. The receptionist was not very helpful initially and said all rooms were like that. Until I told her, I have seen rooms not like that, then only she moved me to one with only one queen bed. That's guest service for you. If you book from the hotel's website, remember to put in the code "metro123" to get a 5% discount. The room rates fluctuated wildly with very high prices typically in the weekend. I wanted to stay for a week, but decided to move to another hotel for the weekend instead. Book early to get cheap rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandra179
Reviews.Content: Close to the Train Station, and therefore all of Sydney, we had a great stay for the two nights that we were in Sydney and if we ever return to Sydney would prefer to stay there again. Lovely rooms with room to move in, which is a definate plus, very clean, all in all a great place to stay. Staff were very helpful with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Retro decor but satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Mixina
Reviews.Content: I was there for an exhibition at Powerhouse Museum. It was only 2 mins away from there so it was really handy to stay at this hotel. I booked via Expedia and price was reasonable. You may say the room decor needs up dating but take it - it is retro! Then, you won't be complaining with spacious room and large balcony! No frills but good enough.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and handy to darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: harrypet
Reviews.Content: we wanted a quiet tranquil spot - this is - on the city fringe - but good location for the powerhouse museum ,the aquarium imax theatre and restaurants' also china town is nearby good rooms and nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “In dire need of refurbishment !”
Reviews.Author: denysenz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and if I hadn't already paid via Wotif we would have walked .The room and bathroom were clean but everything was from the 80's ,We had 2 couches and a chair but nothing matched.The bed was pretty comfortable but because they had squeezed a king into a small space I only had a bout 6 inches between the bed and wall to get out.I asked for a deluxe room and our friends had a standard.Our room was marginally better at least we had a duvet on the bed , they had woollen blankets and those horrible patterned bedspreads which didn't match.Our room was at the back and we looked straight into someone's flat.there was a balcony but nothing to sit on and wouldn't anyway because of it being so overlooked.The bathrooms were tiny and I can't even begin to describe the vanity unit.the toilet seat was round and the toilet oval so the seat didn't even fit it properly , The walls a thin and we had a noisy child next door who stayed up till after midnight every night making a racket so we couldn't sleep.We are fairly fussy when it comes to hotel rooms but for the price of the room I expected much better facilities as it wasn't that cheap and have stayed in great places for the same price.Staff were friendly enough and location ok, a bit of a walk to get to Darling Harbour and the city but we didn't mind that.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD FOR ME”
Reviews.Author: Globerunner7
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights here. Very good, good food and service. Not too far from Sydney centre. Stay here again. Pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Sydney close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: Snookystraveltips
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at this hotel via check-in.com. The price was very good for high season. Our deal for $110 per night which included parking (usually $25 per night), a buffet breakfast and free wifi. The hotel is a well maintained four story building in a good position. Each room has a patio. (a small table with a couple of chairs would have been great). It is a three minute walk to the powerhouse museum, 5 minutes walk to paddy's market, the monorail, tram (light rail) and china towns Dixon street, 7 minutes walk to darling harbour and approx 10 minutes walk to central station. The hotel is in a quiet leafy street. Check in was fast, the staff were welcoming and friendly and always spoke to us when we were coming and going. The staff at breakfast were efficient and always topping up food as needed. Breakfast consisted of 4 or 5 choices of cereal, fruit juice, cold water, milk, tea and coffee, bacon, scrambled eggs, either noodles or hash browns, sausages, fried tomatoes, muffins, and an assortment of bread for toasting, spreads and fruit and yoghurt. The rooms are very large. Ours had a king sized bed and two pull out sofas, bedside tables, desk, drawers, fridge, large wardrobe, iron and ironing board and a bathroom with shower and bathtub. Shampoo, conditioner, liquid soap, hand cream, shaving cream, tissues, shower cap are all provided. So too is tea, coffee, sugar and an electric jug. The rooms themselves are very clean, linen was in good condition and overall very good value for money. Wifi was not working in our room, reception advised they have some modems but none were available so we had to go downstairs to use our computer. There is a small corner shop near the hotel and also a coffee shop and a small restaurant which we did not try. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others wanting a good value hotel in a good location in central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “In need of complete refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: geminiCheshire
Reviews.Content: Our room was dark and shabby.The bathroom was dirty and mouldy and fluorescent light over washbasin full of flies and one tube out completely. Bedcover stained. We were given another room but had a brick wall to look at. There is a square outside area surrounded by a wall and a roof above. No outside furniture is provided so cannot sit out. No outside garden areas or terraces to sit and the hotel lobby is depressing. We were told to take our own cases to the room on arrival but the man behind the reception desk eventually pushed the trolley into the lift and took us to our room. Each day we had to ask for another handtowel as we always received 2 bath towels, one bathmat, and only one handtowel. We were told these facilities were "outsourced" so the hotel did not control them. Breakfast was very poor with just cheap melon cut too near the skin which made it hard. The cooked breakfast was cold and the floor not cleared of spilled cereals. The area for eating had a very dirty acrylic roof over part of it - not very nice. Times for breakfast appeared to vary and we were told it had finished one day at 9.30 when previously it had been until 10a.m. The toaster was antique. To be fair, the staff were quite nice but working with an old hotel that had changed hands a few times and needed a lot of money spent to bring it up to a reasonable standard. Location was another problem as there was nowhere near and each trip meant a fairly long walk to Darling Harbour or to the station. No nearby shops, restaurants, bars etc. A large intake of scoolchildren over the weekend made matters worse as they kept us awake banging doors, playing instruments and talking and laughing into the early hours.

Reviews.Title: “Aspire”
Reviews.Author: bytez
Reviews.Content: Some walking distance from the tram and china town but this place is somewhat peaceful. Bad thing was no free wifi and I gotta pay extra $10 for that. Other than that, it's perfect for a solo trip :)

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rudolphNewZealand
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - walking distance from Central station and to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. The hotel varies room rates each day depending on vacancies so worth checking direct as well as using the internet to book. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean, comfortable and adequately furnished with full bath and overhead shower in the ensuite. Our deal didn't include breakfast and we didn't use the restaurant. However there are cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “very well located hotel,the staff are not helpful/friendly.”
Reviews.Author: deedee7Dublin
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a week in this hotel.its well located in sydney ,within walking distance of darling harbour,its lovely boardwalk restaurents etc.the air con in the lobby doesnt keep you cool,but its ok if the weather isnt hot.its a sort of budget hotel,we were staying for a week ,but it would not be nice for longer.the staff are ok but having been in the cosmopolitan in melbourne i think we were spoilt.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, cheap and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: nickobec
Reviews.Content: I end up in Sydney once or twice a year for conferences and stay in a variety of budget accommodation. As far as budget accommodation goes this is a good one, decent size rooms with what you expect, minimal street noise and desk staff that are very helpful. The decor and fittings are tired, but it is a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good option”
Reviews.Author: tony273
Reviews.Content: I was paying a bargain internet price and so was pleasantly surprised to find the room and bathroom clean, spacious and properly equipped. There was also a large balcony but without furniture. Bed and linen were excellent. Unfortunately, television reception was unacceptably bad. The hotelâ€™s furnishings overall were certainly tired although not shabby. Some background noise from the central air conditioning system at night. The lift broke down on the morning of my departure. There were no bar or food facilities apart from breakfast in the morning. You could apply at reception for a reduced rate voucher for the breakfast although there was nothing in room to say this. If you are good at finding your way, then the hotel is very well located for Chinatown, UTS and Darling Harbour while being in a very quiet location. Overall, a very good option if you are getting a good price but, if you are not, you may be disappointed. I was definitely happy with my stay at the price I was paying.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, So dirty, a horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuna0768
Reviews.Content: We booked couple nights there because of the discounted rate and the location is not too far away from city central. It turned out that the cleanliness is much poorer that most of the backpackers or hostel. We found blood on the sheet cover, holes and stains on the blank and the bedding sheets do not look clean white as well, we found hair on it, it's very disgusting, we wanted to cancel the next night but considering the non-refundable cancellation policy, we slept with pyjama all nights and I swear it's the most disgusting place you will never want to visit. Their air-conditioner is not working, we felt so bad luck but found out our neighbour's showerhead is broken as well, seems every room has some problems.Strongly NOT recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So quiet you don't even know you're in the city!”
Reviews.Author: diva_sparkles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 3 friends as we were attending an event at the Convention Centre. Great location - close to Darling Habour, easy to get to from Central Station and hotel is on a very quiet street - you don't even realize how close you are to the city. Nice kebab shop nearby too for a late night visit!! Room was clean and suitable, although a little bit dated. Requested bedding was provided without any trouble. Staff were fantastic, reccommended a nice bottle shop nearby and were happy to open the bottles and find some glasses for us. Good value for money. Would definately stay here again, and reccommend it to anyone that is going to an event in Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to the city”
Reviews.Author: 1Meerkat
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Aspire (previously Aspen). I chose it last time as it was close to the monorail line, so handy to the theatres. It's very close to the Powerhouse museum, monorail stop, chinatown, haymarket, paddy's markets and the capitol theatre. The rooms are a good size, clean and well maintained, if a bit dated. We had a family deluxe which takes four and there was still room to move around the room with the sofabed out. The balcony is a good size with a view of the city. The restaurant is only open for breakfast but there is plenty nearby to chose from. Staff are friendly and responsive. Comfy beds. My only gripe is that the soap smells like 711 aftershave. Great for short stays but I generally prefer an apartment for a week or more.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in busy city, but this hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Stationary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from Jan. 13- 17 and Feb 2-4 09 while on our 35th wedding anniversary trip. In between we went on a cruise from Auckland NZ to Sydney Australia. This hotel was chosen since it was close to our son's apartment in Glebe. The price was even better when compared to other hotels. Great location, you can walk to Darling Harbour (10 mins), Circular Quay (30 mins.), Sydney Uni. (15 mins.) and Glebe Point Rd. shops (10 mins.). There is a great little coffee shop at Macarthur St and Bulwara Rd. called Cafe Dendu, great cappuccinos and breakfast. The area is residential, quiet and beautiful. Love the birds that make that aaahhhhing sound three to four times ending in the lamenting sounds of cats in heat. All the birds are totally different, from the cockatoos to the Ibis bird. We found the staff genuinely sincere and helpful to meet your needs. I reserved the hotel using their on-line reservations, easy. Check-in was early due to our flight getting in at 10 AM, arriving at the hotel at 11:30 AM. We were given an upgraded room, standard to deluxe. The room is large, with a sliding patio door to a balcony. Nice views of the city and surrounding areas. The bathroom is large and has dispensers of soap, shaving cream and lotion at the vanity, with the shower/tub having shampoo, body wash and conditioner. A real convenience. An in room safe and even 110 volt power in the bathroom. The hotel is in need of refurbishing badly. You can see this on entering the lobby, worn carpet and dated reception counter. The elevator is old but gets you up the 4 floors. The rooms we stayed in are date in their decor, have mold on the ceiling of the bathrooms, dust build up on the baseboards and carpet around the wall. The furniture, couches, are worn on the ends of the arms, carpet is worn and thin, the bureau is old and it still has the old stereo built into the night table. The A/C didn't work for the last two nights of the Jan. stay, even after complaining it was noted and no follow up to my complaint. No one knew anything was wrong, I was dismayed by this hiding of a problem, especially when the temperatures were 30 to 34 C each day. Well, prior to getting into Sydney, I called and was told the A/C problem was repaired. Good, until we arrive and are told, after asking, that it is working sporadically. Great, they put us in another room, funny why we would get placed back into a room that the A/C has problems with. End result, we get an extension of our check out time on the day of our departure. The Reservation Manager was apologetic and forthright in our criticism of the staff. This was the only shortfall, of the staff, that I experienced, no explanation why. All in all, if you look the other way at the shortfalls, pay about $125.00, you get a hotel that is inexpensive and close to the heart of Sydney, with the ambiance of residential living.

Reviews.Title: “Maintenance issues for sure”
Reviews.Author: ikelmay
Reviews.Content: There were positives and negatives for us with our stay. The hotel is located in a peaceful suburb, only a few minutes walk to Darling Harbour and within walking distance of the city. The hotel itself is dated, and is starting to show it. We had problems on arrival with the a/c and were moved right away. However, the balcony door in our new room refused to lock which was not too positive, the fixtures and fittings were slowly falling apart and finally by our third night, the a/c in this room packed up. Given that the outside temperature was almost 42 degrees C this was definitely a problem. Not sure i'd return to this place - we'd consider a better maintained hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Aspire can be an insparation”
Reviews.Author: Metromagic
Reviews.Content: Place; Aspen Hotel Ultimo Sydney Date; 10th November 2008 Reviewer; Tripadvisor member Australia Pretty good hotel with friendly staff, hotel needs urgent facelift. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Location is pretty good, can walk to the City in less than 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: BERNY85
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights with two couple friends. Only 15 mn walk to Circular Quay. Very friendly staff at the counter. The breakfast .....could be better. Good size room. We recommand this hotel which is excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JPCArmidale
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending an academic conference at UTS. When I booked it was called Aspen but by the time I arrived it had changed its name to Aspire. I was pleased with it. Great location, comfortable, reasonable price. Not flash, but a good-sized room with all the things you expect plus a big balcony with sliding doors that opened. I was on the third floor and looked out onto roof-tops so I could leave the door/curtains wide and have a sense of the outside extending beyond my room. The neighbourhood was leafy and residential, as another tripadvisor reviewer had said - surprisingly so given that it was a block back from Harris St and a few minutes walk from Broadway. I felt that I'd made a good choice for my $115/night. On my first morning I was up at 6am thinking I'd walk briskly around Darling Harbour, but was seduced by Bulwara St and explored it and surrounding areas instead, admiring the tenacity of quiet, tree-lined residential spaces in such proximity to the city centre and the snarling mass of arterial roads. I longed to peek inside the victorian terraces and see how many were expensively done up inside and how many might be affordable - judging from the outside, not all were renovated, some (with bicycles chained on the tiny verandahs and none-too-flash exteriors) looked liked they might be student accommodation. I found myself imagining that I could live here, if I had to. I think there'd be a good community feel to it, if only because they all had to turn inwards to appreciate their little patches of peace. I was glad that I'd found out about the Ian Thorpe Aquatic Centre (near the Powerhouse Museum, on Harris St) before I came because otherwise I might not have thought of bringing my swimmers and goggles with me. The $4.50 (student rate) for entry was well-spent given how wonderful it felt doing laps after a long day of sitting and listening to speakers at the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Aspen”
Reviews.Author: All4it
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Aspen in Sydney and it exceeded all my expectations for a value hotel. It was clean, comfortable, quiet and the staff were very helpful. The hotel is in walking distance of a number of smaller restaurants and pubs, as well as being a short walk to Darling Harbour for a much bigger choice. And the price, booked online through the hotel website, was about half of brand-name hotels in the area. Had some problems with the on-line booking and had to ring the hotel but eventually sorted it out. I will definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quite & Close to City Center”
Reviews.Author: tccfairmont
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at Aspen Ultimo. Very friendly staff at the reception (Steve & Pound). We booked a std room but was given a superior room on the 3rd flr with one double & a single bed. When we first arrived at this hotel in the late evening, the surronding looks a little nasty with old run down buildings. However, on a second look around in the day time, the surrounding is very safe & very near to Market City (Chinatown) & Darling Harbour. There is a link-bridge, one block from the hotel to Chinatown, Darling Harbour & Entertainment Center. The hotel is also very near to Powerhouse Museum & Ian Thorpe Aquatic Center. The hotel has a small business center with 2 PCs & a printer. You have to pay $5/hr (there are cheaper ones in city). My booking includes WiFi in the room. Secured car parking is complimentary. There is a small restaurant in the hotel but I suggest you try the Hannah's Pie just down the corner that serves very good Chicken/Mushroom & Seafood Pies. Else Kopitiam (one blk away) has very good Malaysian food. The only down side is the central heating. It gets cold in the middle of the night & the thermostat can only set at 24 degree max. However, will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: sasi7
Reviews.Content: Great check in staff, very helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and clean. It just really needs upgrading. It looks like an old people's home from the 1970's. Close to darling Harbour which's a five minute walk and to Paddington market. If you are happy to walk to get to public transport then this is the place for you. Get a good pair of walking shoes as everywhere is a good 20 minute walk at least. A cafe is nearby serving breakfasts and snacks on week days and there are a few convenience stores close by, although these are very expensive - Â£7 for a bottle of water, chewing gum and a chocolate bar! Great pie shop nearby too!

Reviews.Title: “Aspen Hotel - Good 3 star property”
Reviews.Author: Five2PP
Reviews.Content: The Aspen Hotel in Ultimo is convenient, quiet and clean. It is a basic older style hotel but if you want something that is within walking distance to Capitol Theatre, Chinatown, Paddy's Market, Monorail, Central Station, Powerhouse Museum, Darling Harbour etc etc this is a cheap alternative to the major hotel chains in nearby Darling Harbour and CBD. So much is closeby in the way of restaurants, entertainment etc there seems little point to paying more for the bigger hotels if you only need a base in which to sleep. If more than 2 persons in the room book the Queen/Queen rooms rather than use the sofa beds. The sofa beds are only really comfortable for a child of no more than 10yrs. The rooms are tired but clean and comfortable. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful - nothing is too much trouble. Keeping in mind this is a 3 star property with no frills, I have still rated it as above average due to its location, price and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tambris
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Aspen Hotel (formerly Mercure Ultimo) for a weekend in April while attending a conference at Darling Harbour. Overall, we were happy to stay there. The proximity to Darling Harbour makes this hotel very convenient if that is where you intend to go. A short ten minute walk along a footbridge, and you're there. The city is also easily accessible from here. Ultimo is a quiet, pretty inner-city suburb. The hotel itself was okay, but not great. We had booked a deluxe room, but were put into a standard room. We didn't bother arguing about this, for two reasons. The first is that they let us check in early, which was a huge advantage for us. The second is that we were only charged $150 for the room, which we thought was reasonable given its location. We had no real issues with the room, except that the balcony (where we were allowed to smoke) had no furniture. The staff were always friendly and helpful. I would probably stay here again, especially if I had to visit Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “better than i thought!”
Reviews.Author: truthfulgrrl
Reviews.Content: booked a 2x queen bed, 1x sofa bed on wotif when nothing was available at all...it was very cheap so i didnt expect much at all. was impressed as it was clean, staff were nice and friendly, room was large with balcony, air con, everything was great! the only thing i could complain about was that room service was late and the food was wrong. when they did get it right it looked foul and was very expensive. eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Good City Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenboy-7
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay here. Efficient check-in and friendly young staff. No-one working there seemed to be over 35. At night it felt safe as security were present in the lobby and a card system in operation for main doors and room doors. As it was very "city central" there was some street noise but we were high up and it did not disturb. Rooms clean as was everything else. Good sized bath for a hotel. Room service delivery very prompt. Only had continental buffet in restaurant but plenty of choices for both breakfasts. Helpful concierge staff for directions and departure. No outstanding luxury but a good base for exploring a great city due to good location very near to buses and train hubs. Small negatives: Trays left in corridors for almost a day (not just ours). Terrible choice of music in bar. I know this is very personal but c'mon, thrash metal and heavy acid type dance? I found the beds too soft but that , too, is quite a personal gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just 2mins walk from Chinatown and centre of Sydney, yet in a quiet residential area next door to a small park area. Good quiet location. (turn left out of hotel then down the hill and across the footbridge by the Power Msuem.. easy) Hotel is only very slightly dated, but I would not say dirty. Rooms OK, everything i needed was there and clean and working, so no complaints. Best performing aircon in a hotel room - one that seems to work - what a bonus! Nice balcony as well. Staff very helpful with sightseeing etc. A nice little cheap (Â£45 night?) hotel that has benefit of excellent location. A similar hotel in centre of London wold prob cost 5-10x as much per night... Does not have the 24hr facilities of the larger Mercure or Novotel etc - but I rarely use them anyway. Does have room service and laundry etc.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is fine, hotel is dated and dirty”
Reviews.Author: howarth
Reviews.Content: Just tried to check in and did not bother. No internet in the rooms and the Hotel is in terrible need of an update. Very dirty room. I could barely see out the windows. They had not been cleaned in months. The manager admitted that the hotel is in a serious need of an extensive remodel. This is a one star hotel in its current condition. For the same price you can stay at superior hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Ric8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a king corner room, very spacious with king bed and two sofas. Also with a balcony. Rooms are dated but clean, understand refurbishment is planned. The main things were all good, bed comfortable, aircon works, linen was plentiful and good, shower had enough pressure. In my experience Mercure hotels run with minimal staff, but found front desk very helpful and available. Great location in quiet residential street, near Monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms and Balconies”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. Close to the Monorail (100 metres) and the Explorer Bus Route (50 metres). 200 metres to Paddy's Market. 15 mins walk from Central Station and 20 minutes to city centre. Hotels with balconies (or, indeed, a window that opens) are hard to find in Sydney but all rooms here have a large balcony. Built in the 70's the rooms are very large and seem to have the original furnishings...a little worn but very comfortable. Aircon good. Room safe is handy. Be careful leaving luggage as storage area not locked or monitored. Reception service can be off-hand and people hard to understand. Restaurant needs a redecorate and meals are average. We have stayed 3 times and we will be back in October 2005. Recommend if you pay less than than $150. Not worth rack rate of $295.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: colbuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week and enjoyed its very convenient location, at a short distance from monorail which takes you downtown with a short ride. Besides, the Chinese district and the entertainment one are close to the hotel which means you can get good and cheap food at any time and buy funny and inexpensive gadgets. Room are nothing fancy but they are ok and the street is very quiet. Of course staying in Darling Harbour means being closer to nightlife but we had no troubles travelling back to Mercure Ultimo also at night. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Stacey_AUNZ
Reviews.Content: First impressions weren't that great. Upon arrival the young lady at the desk was borderline rude and not quite as inviting as you would expect hotel staff to be. We had an early flight and arrived before check in so asked if we could store our bags and return later on in the afternoon. When we returned to retrieve our bags, one was missing (coincidentally the bag with all our camera equipment).I realised before I had left the storage room that the hotel was not liable for anything that was stolen or damaged. When explaining what had happened to the young guy at the counter he seemed quite unfazed and unapologetic. By the blank reaction that I recieved, it was quite obvious that he wasn't prepared to even pretend to find out if it had "accidently" been removed. I doubt he even said anything to the manager.I thought to myself "okay my fault for leaving it in storage" end of that matter. So we went back to the counter (minus one bag) and preceeded to check ourselves in. The young guy handed us the key card and promptly disappeard leaving us to wonder what room we were in. Overall the hotel was resonably comfortable. The service unfortunately was incredibly bad. Many staff members (apart from one nice lad) were very standoffish and not very helpful, they seemed like they would rather be somewhere else. A few times I called house keeping and the phone would just ring out. After days out items would be missing from the minibar (we of course got charged for them). When the beds were made, it was as if the blanket was just thrown over. My stay at this hotel, even though the above happened, would have been enjoyable if the staff were friendly and polite.

HotelInfo.Name: Aspire Hotel Ultimo Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 383-389 Bulwara Road, Sydney, New South Wales 2007, Australia
